problems.question: What is the standard wave equation relating speed \(v\), frequency \(f\), and wavelength \(\lambda\)?
problems.hint: This equation is fundamental: speed equals wavelength times frequency.
problems.detailed: The wave equation is \( v = \lambda f \). That means wave speed is the product of its wavelength and frequency.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: If a wave has wavelength 2 m and frequency 5 Hz, what is its speed?
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: If a waveâ€™s speed is fixed and its frequency doubles, what happens to its wavelength?
problems.detailed: Since \( v = \lambda f \), then \( \lambda = v/f \). If frequency doubles, wavelength must halve to keep \( v \) the same.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov

problems.question: Which of these combinations would yield wave speed of 300 m/s?
problems.detailed: Case 1: \( 3 \times 100 = 300 \). Case 2: \( 6 \times 50 = 300 \). Case 3: \( 1.5 \times 200 = 300 \). All give 300 m/s, so answer is D.
problems.author: Cabir Abassov
